SENT.plain: A 2-year-old boy underwent bone marrow transplantation for severe aplastic anemia
Eighteen months later he developed chronic lung disease and dryness of the eyes
Ophthalmologic examination revealed obstruction of the nasolacrimal ducts and marked dilatation of the lacrimal sacs bilaterally
It seems likely that the nasolacrimal duct obstruction was a manifestation of chronic graft-versus-host disease
